intro: Chaenorhinum serpyllifolium subsp. lusitanicum, commonly known as the Lusitanian horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with prominent, horn-like structures at the base. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This subspecies is part of the Boraginaceae family and is known for its ornamental value and ecological importance.
